result.execSummary:
The defendant Diquar D. Henley was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:

*Due to this DV conviction s/he may never possess firearms or ammunition.

*No contact with victim unless approved by the court.

supervisions.notes: *Count 1 conditions apply except for condition time.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Diquar D. Henley

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Diquar D. Henley in court with attorney Brian Christopher Hagner.  Defendant Diquar D. Henley in custody.  Sarah McNutt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
cab
Parties are in court for sentencing.
Statements by each counsel and defendant as to sentencing.  
As to counts 1 and 2 as amended:
Court withheld sentence as to both counts.  Court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on probation for 2 years, concurrent with the sentence defendant is serving,  with the following conditions:
- Serve 120 days in the House of Correction; STAYED pending review.
- Complete batterer's intervention program.
- No contact with victim unless approved by the court.
- Pay DV surcharge plus all other costs and surcharges; civil judgment if not paid.
- Pay supervision fees.
Agent is to contact court within 30 days of his release to schedule a probation review hearing date.
 
Received and filed: Pretrial Sentence Credit, Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Relief, Memorandum of Conditions of Probation. 
Court advised defendant of penalties for violating the no contact order and due to this DV conviction s/he may never possess firearms or ammunition.

Defendant Diquar D. Henley in court with attorney Brian Christopher Hagner.  Benjamin Calvin Verhulst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
cab
The state informs the court that they are ready to proceed on one count.
The victim is present in court.
The district attorney amended the charges as follows:  the penalty enhancer "repeater" is removed as to all 3 counts.
The defendant wants to change his plea.
.
As to counts 1 and 2 as amended:
  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the Information/Complaint as to both charges. Judgment of conviction entered.
As to count 3:
Pursuant to negotiations and on motion of the state, court dismissed and read-in count 3, resisting an officer.
Parties are asking for a sentencing date in Branch 36.
  Sentencing hearing scheduled for September 2, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Diquar D. Henley in court with attorney Brian Christopher Hagner.  Defendant Diquar D. Henley in custody.  Owen M. Piotrowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant NOT produced. Defense counsel requests case be set for Jury Trial. Defendant enters a SPEEDY TRIAL DEMAND. Parties are notified that effective August 1, 2015 this case will be reassigned per rotation to Judge Jeffrey Kremers, Branch 36 in Courthouse room 502. Case adjourned to branch 36.  Jury trial scheduled for August 3, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with DEANNA S.
  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Diquar D. Henley in court with attorney Brian Christopher Hagner.  Defendant Diquar D. Henley in custody.  Owen M. Piotrowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Grady, Branch 23.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 16, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
